text: Odoardo Vicinelli (1684–1755) was an Italian painter of the late-Baroque period. He trained under Giovanni Maria Morandi of Florence. In Rome he also worked with Pietro Nelli. He painted a Madonna and Child with Saints Ignatius, Francesco Borgia, Stanislao Kostka, Aloysius Gonzaga, Francis Xavier, and the blessed Claudio Acquaviva now at the Diocesan Museum next the Sermoneta Cathedral. ==References== * Category:1684 births Category:1755 deaths Category:17th-century Italian painters Category:Italian male painters Category:18th-century Italian painters Category:Tuscan painters Category:Italian Baroque painters
title: Odoardo Vicinelli
